reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We followed the other rave reviews and booked 4 nights at Corte Grimani. Yes, it is absolutely wonderful. Huge spacious rooms and immaculately presented. Not glitzy. Very central location. Discretely positioned, we found it without difficulty by following their map. Adequate English spoken by reception staff. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Accommodation

likes.liked: — Spacious and clean with tasteful decor

reviews.text: We stayed at the Corte Grimani for 4 nights at the end of a 17 day trip to Northern Italy. The stay there was just perfect in every way. It is a small and refined hotel with a private water taxi stop at the front door and 1 block from St. Mark's Square. The front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. We booked a corner suite with two bathrooms and a small kitchen/dining area overlooking the canal. We were really happy with it. The rooms were large and well appointed with classic contemporary furniture. I agree completely with all the other reviewers who liked this hotel. Most amazing was the room rate which we found to be very reasonable in Venice. Because the hotel is so close to St. Mark's Square, you can buy a day pass on the vaporetto (city public water taxi) and be anywhere in the Venice area for sightseeing locations in minutes. In addition, we felt like we had our own apartment in Venice and it felt great to come home to it every night we were in this beautiful city.
reviews.title: Refined and comfortable with great location

likes.liked: — Location, professional, upscale, comfortable and quiet

reviews.text: We found the site through Fodors and/or Trip Advisor. Great Location. Quiet. Clean. Very good staff. The beds were firm (hip, hip, hooray). The a/c worked. We rented a place with a kitchen.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Under 5 minute walk to San Marco Square. The staff was always great about making resturant recommendations.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Great Price

likes.liked: — The location, owners, room and price

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: We really have nothing bad to say. Venice can be tough to navigate when you are trying to find your hotel vs. the train station or however. We took a private water taxi to the hotel. More expensive, but it worked well for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spent 4 nights as part of our honeymoon Europe tour, very hard to find as nobody knows where it is, but worth it when we found it. room over the canal was nice, singing gondoliers were nice in the evening but garbage collectors use the same canals in the morning as do suppliers and everybody else., so noisy in the morning, we will go back in December and take a room off the canal
reviews.title: great but hard to find

reviews.text: We walked into our apartment at Corte Grimani and our first reaction was "This is the cleanest place we have ever stayed at in Italy." And we have stayed in small pensiones as well as 5 star hotels over the years. The hotel was an apartment building which was completely renovated in 2005 into 3 apartments per floor and is wonderful for families as there is so much room. It is about a 3 minute walk to Piazza San Marco.
reviews.title: What a great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had apartments #501 and #503, both on the top floor with delightful views over the rooftops. #501, which easily sleeps 6 (i king bed, 2 pull out queen size couches, 2 bathrooms as well as a living room/kitchen) also looked out over the canals - at a confluence of two so we could see bridges, activity, etc. Yet with the windows closed we heard just about nothing. There is a separate charge of 10 Euro/day for the use of the full kitchen as well as a 50 Euro kitchen cleaning charge. You can have breakfast brought to you for 15 Euro each (cereal, bread, croissants, yogurt, slice of ham and of cheese plus coffee/tea or chocolate) if you don't want to do it yourself. (Do be aware that if you arrive late on a Saturday you will have to go quite a ways on Sunday to get groceries as the small local groceries are closed on Sunday.)
reviews.title: Only place in Venice that we've stayed that we would come back to!

likes.liked: — All the rooms, location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Donatella, the manager, was a great help via email prior to our stay - from where do we want the crib to arranging a motoscafi (water taxi) to pick us up at the train station and deposit us 4 feet from the front door. About 80 Euro for that, but well worth it if you are with a family and tired - plu you get such a wonderful first moments in Venice, down the Grand canal and then through a bunch of small canals. The front desk staff was very helpful and exceedingly friendly throughout the stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location with just one problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a 2 night stay at the Corte Grimani for my husband's 60th birthday. It was everything I'd hoped for and more. Donatella thoughtfully provided us with a bottle of Prosecco on our arrival for my husband's birthday. As stated this was our 4th (but NOT last visit to Venice) my favourite city and this was the first place we've stayed that we would definitely both revisit.
reviews.title: great place to stay but...

likes.disliked: — payment in cash as a 'special offer' was misleading

reviews.text: We decided to stay at this gem of a hotel after reading the wonderful reveiws on Trip Advisor, and it did not disappoint. Donatella, Guido, and the entire staff helped us with everything from restaurant reservations to tracking down lost luggage. We took a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotels doorstep. It was expensive, but well worth it, especially with luggage. Venice is not the easiest place to get around with luggage. The hotel is located right around the corner from St. Marks Square, away from all of the crowds and noise. It is tucked away on a charming little street that's easy to find once you have been there.
reviews.title: Truly Enjoyed the Residence Corte Grimani

reviews.text: We stayed in 2 apartments on the 4th floor that were both spacious and clean. We looked forward to returning to them each evening after a long day of sightseeing. We did not use the kitchen, but did order breakfast from the hotel on the last morning of our stay. It was both plentiful and well worth the cost of 12 euros per person.
reviews.title: Made the holiday

reviews.text: We will always remember our trip to Venice and the wonderful hospitality we received at the Residence Corte Grimani.
reviews.title: Superb Choice

likes.liked: — Fresh, large, airy and very central - with great,functioning air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a real pleasure staying at this hotel for a number of reasons. 1) Comfort and decor were very good. 2) Location: very close to San Marco but relatively quiet / exclusive area - nice shops etc. 3) The suite was perfect for sharing with our two 8 year olds. 4) The staff were very helpful at all times. 5) Room service was reasonably priced. We opted for the breakfast (served in the room) on one day of our stay - it was excellent and more than ample (too much) - @12 euro a head we found it expensive ( because our children just wanted juice and bread) and we could find a good breakfast for at least half this price in local bars. It was our first trip to Venice and the experience was greater than our expectations, in part this was because we enjoyed this hotel as a family. We will certainly be recommending this accommodation to friends.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Don't hesitate to stay here - it's a lovely hotel, well deserving of its Trip Advisor awards. We stayed in 501 - 2 huge rooms, (I massive double bed, 2 double sofa beds) 2 bathrooms, kitchen and dining area. Beautifully decorated and quiet location; pretty views of canal. Very helpful front desk staff, helped with great restaurant recommendations and airport travel logistics. Ample breakfasts, plenty of variety, served in room (no restaurant in the hotel). Central - short walk from St Marks. Free 15 mins internet use via lobby pc - useful for flight check-in etc. Our teenager complained that the sofa bed matress was a bit hard! Great shopping nearby (above Armani) and numerous reastaurants in the vicinity.
reviews.title: fabulous with a baby

likes.liked: — The space the location and the price
likes.disliked: — I cannot fault it in any way

reviews.text: Just returned from 2 nights at the Corte Grimani. What a find! This is a fabulous place to stay. 2 minutes from St Marks Square but a calm oasis amidst the hustle and bustle. The room was fabulous, plenty of room for us and our 2 children aged 14 and 11. The staff were very helpful. I could not fault our stay.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on the other reviews and were not disappointed. Fantastic location, only 5 mins walk from St Marks but in a very quiet cul de sac so no noise at night which was ideal. We had one of the smaller apartments which was just perfect - did not need the kitchen facilities but having a fridge and kettle was ideal for my early morning cup of tea. Lovely huge bed and tons of wardrobe space, far more than we needed. Great bathroom (with shower caps!) and I can see how this would be great for families as the facilities with dishwasher, clothers dryer etc are fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, excellent value

likes.liked: — Masses of space, huge bed, very quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for recommendations for restaurants and both were excellent. We only did the breakfast on our last morning and it was pretty good value for the money. We should probably have done it more often as we found it surprisingly hard to get breakfast at a reasonable price locally (unlike France where every single cafe will do one). However a minor issue. We got the water taxi there and back and although expensive would definitely recommend this to guests as it is so much more convenient than waiting for the vaporetto and dragging your luggage across St Marks. We were on a very late evening flight and the hotel staff were more than happy for us to make full use of the lounge, watch TV etc after a long days shopping.
reviews.title: Wow! Awesome Hotel!

reviews.text: Would defininitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A great choice.

reviews.text: Well words escape as to how great this hotel was!
reviews.title: Another 5

likes.disliked: — Charge for cleaning the kitchen (was told about this so we didn't use it)
